definitions.definition: on or to the inner part of something/somebody; within something/somebody

examples.text: Inside the box was a gold watch.
She made a film about what life was like inside the refugee camp.
You'll feel better with a good meal inside you.
Inside most of us is a small child screaming for attention.

definitions.definition: in less than the amount of time mentioned

examples.text: The job is unlikely to be finished inside (of) a year.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (denoting the interior of the body): from in + side.
